# TESS Program G06138

Title: Flares And Coronal Mass Ejections In Open Clusters

PI: Roettenbacher, Rachael - University Of Michigan

Type: SMALL

Summary: Coronal mass ejections (CMEs) are among the most energetic events on our Sun, yet stellar detections are challenging. In this study, we plan to find CMEs in two open clusters and use TESS for simultaneous monitoring. We plan to observe M44 with the MDM/OSMOS multi-object spectrograph. A time series of optical spectra could reveal enhancements on the wings of Balmer lines, as seen in previous detections of stellar CMEs. The Hyades cluster will be observed by the LOFAR radio array, where CMEs can be detected as Type II radio bursts for the first time. In both cases, 20-s TESS light curves will provide the precise times of stellar flares, high energy brightenings that are usually accompanied by CMEs on the Sun. The target list consists of 33 cluster members with known flaring activity.
